cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles west of Cabo Cruz, Cuba and 100 miles south of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest across central Cuba tonight and Monday, emerging into the Florida Straits, then turning north-northwest and riding up the eastern Gulf of Mexico parallel to (and just offshore of) Florida’s west coast toward the Big Bend/Tampa Bay area.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida’s west coast near the Tampa Bay–Big Bend region

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch from Ocean Reef northward to Flamingo and along Florida’s west coast from Flamingo to the Anclote River, including Florida Bay; also parts of the Keys and Cayman Islands.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning for the Florida Keys from Craig Key westward to the Dry Tortugas and much of Cuba’s southern coast.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West coast of Florida (Flamingo through the Big Bend), Florida Keys, with broader impacts spreading northward along the U.S. Southeast coast later in the week.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (30–40 mph) are possible Tuesday as outer rainbands sweep across southeast Florida; overall probability remains low (≤16%).
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation of 1–2 ft possible along Atlantic beaches; primary surge threat remains on Florida’s west coast.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with isolated 6-inch pockets Tuesday into early Wednesday, producing brief urban and poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible Monday afternoon through Tuesday; rough surf and rip currents beginning Monday night.
